wikipedia_page.main:
Clifford Blackburn Edgar (1857–1931[1]) was a Coalition Conservative MP for Richmond in Surrey.
He won the seat in 1918, but lost it to an Independent Unionist in 1922.
He was a member of Surrey County Council[2] and also Mayor of the Municipal Borough of Richmond (Surrey). 
A photographic portrait of him, by Walter Stoneman, is in the collection of the National Portrait Gallery, London.
